thread.title: The Texans' QB misery, summed up in one tweet
thread.title_full: The Texans' QB misery, summed up in one tweet

author: tmachir@sportingnews.com (Troy Machir)
title: The Texans' QB misery, summed up in one tweet
text:
The Texans' QB misery, summed up in one tweet Sporting News 9 hrs ago tmachir@sportingnews.com (Troy Machir) On Thursday night, the Texans dropped their fourth game of the season with a 27-20 loss to the Colts.
AdChoices Ryan Mallett was benched early in the second quarter after 7-for-10 passing for 51 yards and one interception in favor of Brian Hoyer, who, aside from a first half Hail Mary to Jaelen Strong , didn't exactly summon his inner John Elway.
MORE: Week 5 photos | Week 5 picks | Worst offseason moves | Texans whiff on Foster injury
Just look at Mallett's face. This is AFTER the Texans scored a touchdown.
Ryan Mallett's actual reaction to the Texans last TD pic.twitter.com/vxLcepLjlp
— NFLonCBS (@NFLonCBS) October 9, 2015 Want to know how bad things got for the Texans?
This is John Skelton. Yes, the same John Skelton who in 20 NFL appearances threw 25 interceptions and fumbled the ball 11 times.
And I'm not in the league...
— John Skelton (@johnskelton19) October 9, 2015 To Hoyer's credit he did finish with 312 yards through the air and threw two touchdowns to just one interception, albeit a game-ending one.
Sorry, John Skelton, you aren't the answer.
Go to MSN Home
